Falters at times: The claim falters at times because it states that a "wide majority of NRA households supported this legislation," but the polls mentioned were conducted before the relevant legislation was filed in the Senate.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support because it only provides information from two polls conducted before the legislation was filed, which may not accurately reflect the views of NRA households at the time of the legislation.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption that the polls conducted before the legislation was filed accurately represent the views of NRA households on the specific legislation in question.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the support shown in the polls, such as the wording of the questions or the context in which they were conducted, which could impact the accuracy of the claim.
